author: pbr
title: great motor but challenging to mount well
review:
Motor has an awesome power-to-weight ratio.

However unlike its big brother, it has no technic mounting points on the top, bottom, sides, or back - only 4 pin-holes right on the "face" of the motor - around the drive shaft hole.

It's already a long motor, so having to face-mount the motor makes the whole assembly even longer.  Alternatively, you have to mix studded and technic building techniques.

Since clutch gears like the white 60c01 are larger than the face of the motor, this makes using them with this motor a challenge, limiting its usefulness in cases where there motor is being used to drive something back and forth between two end-points.

Without a clutch gear you end up with a "horrible grinding noise" when this motor is used with a linear actuator, as documented here: http://www.brickset.com/detail/?Set=8264-1

In kit 8264 an M motor is paired directly to a linear actuator, with no clutch.  ouch.
